page.title: 07MAIN RAILWAY LINE
page.content: This runs between{Cheltenham}and {Gloucester}and forms the main line between the Midlands and North of England,and the South West, South Wales and London. The line was opened in{1839}as part of the Bristol and Birmingham Railway. Passenger trains travel from as far away as Aberdeen,Glasgow,Newcastle and Leeds in the North to Bristol,Plymouth and Penzance in the South-West. On average 79 trains per day use the northbound line:54% passenger trains, 29% freight trains and 8% empty coaching stock.The southbound line carries 71 trains per day:59% passenger trains,32% freight trains and 8% empty coaching stock. The line is particulary heavily used by holiday makers in the summer.
